text: Hello everyone, I am just getting started with HubSpot, and have been working through the local development documentation. I use VS Code for my local development, and have installed the HubSpot Hubl Snippets and HubSpot VS Code Extension. The problem I am having is with code formatting. When I would save one of my 'html + hubl' template files, all the markup gets squished and hard to read. In my settings.json I ended up setting
Any suggestions on how to fix this? I do have the 'Prettier' extension installed as well.

Unfortunately Prettier doesn’t support HubL files and targets `.html` and `.css` files. Disabling `formatOnSave` is one option, as you’ve noted. Another suggestion would be to add a prettierignore file like this to your project: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/.prettierignore>
